content.description:
Classique. Deux départs possible, tout dépendant de votre taille, mais le reste de la voie vous prendra de la force et un peu de technique, peu importe votre grandeur.

plaquettes

Traverse in from the right side on the ledge system that bisects the cliff at about 10' up. Climb up a small left-facing corner to a left-leaning crack/flake on a slab that leads to the base of the open book/flake. Climb the open book to its top and either step left or right and finish to the bolted anchor. On the right side of the ledge system that bisects the cliff about about 10' up. Standard rack

Descent: Bolted anchor, rappel

Start as for Chauve-souris but break up and right from the left-angling flake/slab. Climb the discontinuous crack system in the corner/groove until you gain the prominent groove above with a hand crack in the back. Follow this to a ledge and then crank out the last moves in a left-facing flake to the anchor. Same start as Chauve-Souris. Standard rack, doubles in .75-2 (camalot size) coule be useful.

Bolted anchor

Would be a lot better if it got traffic and cleaned up a bit. This is the striking tips crack seen on the right side of the overhanging buttress on the right-side of the Left End. Traverse in from the right on the ledge system until you reach the stance below the bolt. Gain the bolt, fire a hard move and then climb up and left into the slabby right-facing corner to a stance at the base of the tips crack. Climb the crack to a small ledge that bisects the cliff. Continue up your choice of easier cracks to a fixed anchor on the left side of the block. About 30 feet uphill and right of Chauve-souris just before the trail levels out on the way to the main wall. 1 bolt
Standard rack to 1.5", small wires/cams.

Gain the ledge and then angle right from the left-facing corner to the first bolt. Follow fun moves for the next few bolts on the overhanging face/broad arete till a rest under the roof. Charge out the roof passing a couple bolts and choose an exit (choose wisely) to the bolted anchor.

Rejoindre la vire, aller tout droit jusqu'à la 1er plaquette. Ensuite des mouvements fun jusqu'à l'arête sous le toit pour un repos. Sortez du toit en suivant les plaquettes ensuite choisir une sortie (choisissez judicieusement) vers le relais.



Start at the right end of the ledge system that bisects the cliff.

Commencez à l'extrémité droite du système de vire qui divise la partie la plus a gauche de la falaise en deux.


7 bolts + anchor.

7 plaquettes + relais

Very cruxy route, at the 3rd bolt the crux is waiting for you, once passed, the route is done, it's 5.11 to get to the top. Unstable block near the crux.

Voie très cruxy, arrivé à la 3e bolt le crux vous attend, une fois passé, la voie est faite, c’est du 5.11 pour se rendre en haut. Bloc instable près du crux.



Just to the right of Julep.


Trad, 6 bolts.

(AKA Lézard) A cool crux on a great feature! The moves on the flake are very enjoyable and offer fun positioning! Crank out the move to the first bolt (not really that bad). Then tech your way up the high-angle slab/face to a stance below the small overlap. Figure out the positioning needed to pull out of the overlap into the small left-facing corner that leads to heroic positioning on the cool flake feature. Continue right to the anchor. Start: About 20 feet left of Chauve-souris beneath a bolt 10 feet up. 8 bolts, two-bolt anchor

La dernière ligne de plaquettes à gauche. Une bien jolie voie modérée.

5 plaquettes
The left side of the cliff is best identified  by the large open book at the left end of the cliff.
